author: Monsieur B
subject: Re: DVD - 1st Series Lupin the 3rd Questions
body:
Hi Conrad!

I bought myself the 1st series on DVD this summer.
It was just released by Yamato Video in Italy.

Strange thing is that the DVDs don't have any
subtitling... They come with 3 audio tracks, being
Japanese and Italian (original dub and new dub).
Since I speak Italain, it's not much of a problem for
me... but clearly, this is not for everybody !

You can order the 5 DVDs from Yamato Video web site on
http://www.yamatovideo.com/temporaneo/index.html
They are about 50 000 Lit each which brings you to a
big total of 250 000 Lit (!) around $115 US for those
who wonder - and you'll agree this is not expensive at
all for 5 DVDs !

+ I believe they have a psecial offer if you order
them all at once (something like free shipping).

As for the quality - this is going to sound very
stupid - I haven't had the time to go through all of
them yet.
The DVD boxes are just perfect with new art and a
double page booklet in every DVD presenting the Lupin
saga (how they did the series, with who and why it
didn't work out at first...)

As for the animation, the image is clean (i should say
VERY clean), the audio is a beautiful italian dub like
the ones I've grown up with :)...
That's the best I can do right now !
If you need more info, ask and I'll do what I can !

Mr B.

PS : about the 2nd series,
